intro: Senecio chapalensis, commonly known as the Chapalense groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Senecio chapalensis is often found in grasslands and fynbos vegetation, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
